page.shortlink: api client api a5 panellayout class

argument.name: panels
argument.description: The panels to use in the layout. See *[link:A5.PanelLayout Panel Object]*.

argument.name: settings
argument.description: Settings for the panel layout. This will override the initial values of the properties of the A5.PanelLayout class.

discussion.p: The panel layout can be used to layout multiple panels either horizontally or vertically.

Panels in the layout can be docked, so that they are viewed by request only. Docking can be done either at the start (before) or end (after) the flow of the layout. Panels can be set to auto collapse when there is not enough space to show all panels.

The layout will dynamically hide panels if there is not enough room to show them, even if the panels are not set to auto dock. When this happens, navigating the hidden panels can be accomplished by using the A5.PanelLayout.firstPanel/A5.PanelLayout.prevPanel/A5.PanelLayout.nextPanel/A5.PanelLayout.lastPanel methods, or setting a particular panel active using A5.PanelLayout.setActivePanel.

Layouts also support flow collapsing - useful to allow the user to temporarily increase the size of a portion of the layout. When the A5.PanelLayout.collapseFlow method is used, all the panels before the indicated panel will be collapsed, so that the indicated panel is the first visible panel. If multiple panels are collapse, the expanding of them may be done in the reverse order of which they were collapsed, or all collapsing can be removed at once.

property.name: theme
property.description: The theme to use on the panel layout.

property.name: override
property.description: The overrides to use on the panel layout.

property.name: renderMode
property.description: If the panel layout is in a navigator or layout, renderMode controls when the panel layout is created. A blank value (the default) will create the panel automatically when the parent is created. A value of "auto-create" will create the panel when it becomes. A value of "auto-create-destroy" will do the same, but also destroy it when it is hidden.

property.name: flow
property.description: The flow of the panels in the layout. Values can be "ltr" (left to right), "rtl" (right to left), "ttb" (top to bottom) or "btt" (bottom to top). The default is "ltr".

property.name: placeholderHTML
property.description: If the panel layout is created dynamically the placeholder HTML to use until it has been created. This can be used to display a waiting message while the panel is being rendered.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the panel layout.

property.name: header
property.description: The panel header settings.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the panel header. The default value is false if the HTML is blank, and true if it is not.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to put in the panel header. The placeholders "{panel.id}" (the ID of the panel), "{panel.name}" (the name of the panel if it is in a panel navigator or layout) and "{panel.title}" (the title of the panel if it is in a panel navigator or layout) will be automatically replaced.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the panel header.

property.name: style
property.description: The inline CSS to put on the panel header.

property.name: body
property.description: The panel body settings.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the panel body.

property.name: ltrClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the panel body when the flow is "ltr".

property.name: rtlClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the panel body when the flow is "rtl".

property.name: ttbClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the panel body when the flow is "ttb".

property.name: bttClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the panel body when the flow is "btt".

property.name: style
property.description: The inline CSS to put on the panel body.

property.name: footer
property.description: The panel footer settings.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the panel footer. The default value is false if the HTML is blank, and true if it is not.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to put in the panel footer. The placeholders "{panel.id}" (the ID of the panel), "{panel.name}" (the name of the panel if it is in a panel navigator or layout) and "{panel.title}" (the title of the panel if it is in a panel navigator or layout) will be automatically replaced.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the panel footer.

property.name: style
property.description: The inline CSS to put on the panel footer.

property.name: overlay
property.description: The panel overlay settings. The panel overlay is for HTML elements to be absolutely positioned over the panel (such as floating buttons).

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the panel overlay.The default value is false if the HTML is blank, and true if it is not.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to put in the panel overlay. The placeholders "{panel.id}" (the ID of the panel), "{panel.name}" (the name of the panel if it is in a panel navigator or layout) and "{panel.title}" (the title of the panel if it is in a panel navigator or layout) will be automatically replaced.

property.name: dock
property.description: The docked panel settings.

property.name: method
property.description: The mother by which to show docks. Values can be "overlay" (float docked panels over the main layout), "underlay" (show docked panels as if they where hidden under the main layout) and "push" (show docks by pushing the main layout aside). The default is "overlay".

property.name: panel
property.description: Docked panel settings.

property.name: beforeClassName
property.description: The class name to put on a docked panel if it is docked to the start of the flow.

property.name: afterClassName
property.description: The class name to put on a docked panel if it is docked to the end of the flow.

property.name: flowLock
property.description: Flow lock settings for when a dock panel is shown.

property.name: has
property.description: Whether or not to lock the flow so the user cannot interact with non-docked panels when a docked panel is shown. The default value is true.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the element used to lock the flow.

property.name: controls
property.description: Layout control bindings.

property.name: prev
property.description: A previous panel button.

property.name: has
property.description: Whether or not the panel layout has a previous panel button. The default value is false.

property.name: id
property.description: The ID of the button element (which must already be in the DOM). The default is "{panel.id}.CTRL.PREV".

property.name: settings
property.description: The button settings.

property.name: next
property.description: A next panel button.

property.name: has
property.description: Whether or not the panel layout has a next panel button. The default value is false.

property.name: id
property.description: The ID of the button element (which must already be in the DOM). The default is "{panel.id}.CTRL.NEXT".

property.name: settings
property.description: The button settings.

property.name: dock
property.description: An array of buttons to bind to the showing of individual docked panels. The array should contain objects, each of which have an "id" property with the id of the button, a "panel" property with the name of the panel in the layout, and a "settings" property with the button settings. The "panel" property can be set to one of three system options instead of a panel name. These are "*before" (all the panels docked at the start), "*after" (all the panels docked at the end) and "*generic" (all docked panels). These values will dropdown a menu from the button with the a list of all the docked panels at the start and/or end of the layout.

property.name: animation
property.description: Re-layout animation.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of animation to use. Values can be "slide" (the default) or "none".

property.name: duration
property.description: How long the animation should take in millisecond. The default is 400.

property.name: state
property.description: The current state of the panel layout.

property.name: activePanel
property.description: The name of the active panel.

property.name: firstPanel
property.description: The name of the first panel visible in the layout.

property.name: lastPanel
property.description: The name of the last panel visible in the layout.

property.name: flowCollapsed
property.description: Whether or not the layout flow has been collapsed.

property.name: hasPrevPanel
property.description: Whether or not there is a previous panel.

property.name: prevPanel
property.description: The name of the previous panel.

property.name: hasNextPanel
property.description: Whether or not there is a next panel.

property.name: nextPanel
property.description: The name of the next panel.

property.name: hasDockPanel
property.description: Whether or not there are any docked panels in the layout.

property.name: beforeDockPanels
property.description: The names of all the panels docked to the start of the flow.

property.name: afterDockPanels
property.description: The names of all the panels docked to the end of the flow.

property.name: dockPanelShown
property.description: Whether or not a docked panel is shown.

property.name: currentDockPanel
property.description: The name of the currently shown docked panel.

property.name: onInitialize
property.description: Event fired when the panel is initialized. This does not necessarily mean the panel elements have been created, but rather that the class was.

property.name: onSize
property.description: Event fired when the panel is sized.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The sizing data.

argument.name: width
argument.description: The width of the panel in pixels.

argument.name: height
argument.description: The height of the panel in pixels.

argument.name: changed
argument.description: Whether the size actually changed.

argument.name: old
argument.description: The old size of the panel.

argument.name: width
argument.description: The old width of the panel in pixels.

argument.name: height
argument.description: The old height of the panel in pixels.

property.name: onCreate
property.description: Event fired when the panel is created.

argument.name: element
argument.description: The panel element.

argument.name: bodyElement
argument.description: The panel body element.

argument.name: headerElement
argument.description: The panel header element.

argument.name: footerElement
argument.description: The panel footer element.

property.name: onActivate
property.description: Event fired when the panel is activated by a parent panel navigator or layout.

property.name: onView
property.description: Event fired when the panel is viewed by a parent panel navigator or layout. It should be noted that unlike the onActivate event, this event will fire regardless of the panel already being active.

property.name: onBeforeDestroy
property.description: Event fired before the panel is destroyed.

property.name: onDestroy
property.description: Event fired when the panel is destroyed.

property.name: onLayoutRefresh
property.description: Event fired when the panel layout is refreshed.

property.name: onDockPanelShow
property.description: Event fired when a docked panel is shown.

argument.name: panel
argument.description: The name of the dock panel shown.

property.name: onDockPanelHide
property.description: Event fired when a docked panel is hidden.

argument.name: panel
argument.description: The name of the dock panel hidden.

property.name: onBeforePanelActivate
property.description: Event fired before a panel in the layout is activated. Can return false to stop activation.

argument.name: panel
argument.description: The name of the panel being activated.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the panel being activated.

property.name: onPanelActivate
property.description: Event fired when a panel in the layout is activated.

argument.name: panel
argument.description: The name of the panel being activated.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the panel being activated.

property.name: onPanelView
property.description: Event fired when a panel in the layout is views.

argument.name: panel
argument.description: The name of the panel being activated.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the panel being activated.
